message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and Innovation follow-up surveys in Latin America and the Caribbean, we investigate the relationship between innovation activities and employment growth.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Innovation follow-up surveys"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Innovation"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes data from two main sources: Administrative tax data and a series of household surveys conducted in Brazil, El Salvador, and Uruguay.", "dataset": ["Administrative tax data", "household surveys"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset covering 85 countries from 1990 to 2015 to analyze the relationship between corporate governance and firm behavior.", "dataset": ["unique dataset"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This report utilizes data from the Global Financial Inclusion Index and the World Bank Wealth Accounting and Valuation of Ecosystems (WAVES) project to examine the relationship between financial inclusion and natural capital degradation.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion Index", "World Bank Wealth Accounting and Valuation of Ecosystems (WAVES)"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze the impact of extractive industries on local communities, we rely on data from four datasets: Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI), Revenue Watch Index, Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI), and Afrobarometer.", "dataset": ["Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI)", "Revenue Watch Index", "Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI)", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from the United Nations population division to study the age structure of migration flows across countries.", "dataset": ["United Nations population division"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's private participation in infrastructure (PPI) project database, we compare the characteristics of public-private partnership projects across different sectors and regions.", "dataset": ["World Bank's private participation in infrastructure (PPI) project database"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the relationship between climate change and agricultural productivity using a rich panel dataset from 52 African countries over the period 1980-2015.", "dataset": ["rich panel dataset"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses nationally representative survey data from Burkina Faso and Senegal to investigate the effect of school construction on educational achievement.", "dataset": ["nationally representative survey data"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "By merging microdata from the Indonesian Family Life Survey (IFLS) with geospatial information on the prevalence of malaria, we explore the impact of health shocks on labor productivity in rural Indonesia.", "dataset": ["Indonesian Family Life Survey (IFLS)"], "topic": ["Health"]} ]
